title: Nha Xuan Tay Residence / G+ Architects
description: Project Context – Nha Xuan Tay is situated on a small hill in Xuan Tay commune, approximately 8 km away in a straight line. The house was designed for a young family returning to their hometown, seeking a weekend retreat where their children could connect with nature and extended family. Improved infrastructure between Ho Chi Minh City and Dong Nai made this lifestyle more accessible.
author: Valeria Silva

title: House Rinconada / Oioioi
description: Located in a privileged natural setting, the project arises from the desire to establish a subtle dialogue between architecture, landscape, and living. The project unfolds on a single level, prioritizing horizontality as a strategy to blend with the land and the surrounding garden.
author: Paula Pintos

title: These Apartments Are Like Sculptures You Can Live In
description: In the heart of Brighton, Melbourne, Wood Marsh has delivered a fresh take on coastal living with Esplanade Brighton, a medium-density housing project that’s bold in form but deeply respectful of its surroundings. Set across a former brownfield site, the development includes 24 townhouses and 11 apartments spread over four distinct buildings, all woven into a lush native garden.
author: Erin

title: These 4 Homes Are a Cat’s Dream Come True
description: As pet-friendly design evolves, more homeowners are asking architects and interior designers to consider the needs of their cats, not just as pets, but as part of the family. From built-in walkways to custom furniture, these four homes show how thoughtful design can create spaces where cats thrive and aesthetics remain intact. Whether it’s climbing, hiding, or simply observing from above, each project offers creative solutions for living stylishly with feline companions.
author: Erin

title: Porsche and Norman Foster Are Building Bridges Inspired by Dreams
description: Gateway to Venice's Waterway is a dynamic aluminum bridge leaping over water by Porsche and Norman Foster that inspires a new wave of mobility.

title: Z Museum by TEAM_BLDG Reimagines Rural Cultural Infrastructure
description: TEAM_BLDG transforms a 1990s concrete house into China's first contemporary rural weaving museum in Songzhuang Village.
